title: Community Engagement
description: Engaged with community members and educators about our program, building strong local support and partnerships for our robotics initiative.

title: Budget Finalized
description: Successfully finalized our comprehensive team budget, establishing clear financial planning and resource allocation for our inaugural season.

title: Full Team Meeting
description: Held our first comprehensive full-team meeting, bringing together all members to align on goals, roles, and our path forward.

title: Sol Siesta Partnership
description: Partnered with Sol Siesta Apparel for a merchandising deal, enabling us to create branded team merchandise and additional revenue streams.

title: Workshop Visits & Event
description: Visited 316 LUNATECS workshop and attended the Duel on the Delaware REEFSCAPE FRC unofficial event, gaining valuable experience and networking.

title: Website Launch & FIRST Meeting
description: Launched our official team website and met with the Executive Director of FIRST Mid-Atlantic, establishing our presence and connections.

title: 1640 DAR Workshop Visit
description: Visited 1640 Downingtown Area Robotics workshop, learning from experienced teams and exploring collaboration opportunities.

title: GoFundMe Launch
description: Launched our GoFundMe campaign to raise funds for equipment, travel, and competition expenses for our inaugural season.

title: Student Interest & Social Media
description: Gathered over 40 interested students and operated a successful social media campaign reaching over 60 students in our community.

title: Team Identity & Partnership
description: Finalized our team name and brand identity, and partnered with 1168 Malvern Robotics, establishing our place in the FRC community.

title: Adult Volunteers Onboarded
description: Successfully onboarded 3 adult volunteers, providing essential mentorship and guidance for our team operations.

title: Social Media Launch
description: Launched our active social media presence @10989blast, connecting with the broader FRC community and promoting our team.

title: 1712 Dawgma Workshop Visit
description: Visited 1712 Dawgma's workshop, gaining hands-on experience and learning from veteran team members.

title: FIRST Registration
description: Officially registered Team 10989 with the FIRST organization, marking our formal entry into the FIRST Robotics Competition.

title: Workspace Partnership
description: Discussed securing a dedicated workspace in Berwyn with Eadeh Enterprises, establishing our home base for robot development.

title: Mentorship from 1712 Dawgma
description: Received valuable mentorship from FRC Team 1712 Dawgma, gaining insights from experienced competitors and building lasting connections.

title: Comcast Commitment
description: Received a $3000 commitment from Comcast, our first major sponsorship that provided crucial funding for our team's launch.

title: The Spark
description: A group of passionate individuals in Berwyn, PA identified the need for a community-based FIRST Robotics team, setting our journey in motion.
